content: Just try explaining the basics: knowing the domain name of the account often helps, such as Gmail, Outlook, etc. Seeing a screenshot of the error message and screen can often be a big help. In general, select new account>email and on next panel enter your name and email address - and I suggest NOT entering password yet. and let us know what happens.
creator: davidsk

content:
- go to TB menu > Settings > Appearance > Message List and select Table View if it isn't already

- click the Date header on the Message List to change the sort order

- go back to TB menu > Settings > Appearance > Message List and select Cards View if that's what you want

content: My guess is that the faulty account is an IMAP account. Try this, it might help: in Thunderbird open the Account settings tab, select "Copies & Folders" of your account, activate the radio button ◉ Other , open the drop-down menu with the list of your accounts and select "Sent" for your account (see image)

creator: TLOdell

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: Il server SMTP precedente lo hai eliminato da Thunderbird? In Menu > Impostazioni account > NOME_ACCOUNT alla voce Server di posta in uscita è associato il giusto server SMTP? Puoi aggiungere degli screenshot delle impostazioni che dici essere corrette (oscurando i dati privati)?
creator: @next

content: In precedente server SMTP non posso eliminarlo perché rimane attivo per gli utenti che fanno capo alle enail di un secondo provider. Ho, tuttavia, eliminato il mio utente che usava il precedente server e l'ho ricreato (nella voce "Server di posta in uscita"). Allego, dopo aver tolti gli altri utenti, lo screenshot della voce Server di posta in uscita, dalla quale risulta il nome del nuovo server che, lo ricordo, funziona perfettamente con tutti gli altri utenti ai quali l'ho riassegnato....

content:
well, you can do a search for date, then highlight the results and move to a separate folder Then, you can use the importexporttools NG addon to export as an mbox and import as mbox on the other drive OR, you can exit thunderbird after creating the folder and copy from the profile and, after switching to new drive to paste into the profile there. I suggest using the Mail\Local Folders folder.

Those are the basics, but if you need more detail, let me know. They can also be merged into an existing folder, but that's more detail and can get a bit messy, but does work ok for POP.
creator: davidsk

content:
thanks for this david. i am generally aware of the file structure that thunderbird uses and when i have explored these data files, i have not found individual email files. so where would i target my search?

i don't mind trying to merge them into an existing folder. my email is a set up as POP.

eric
creator: ericstephenstevens

content: Each message folder is in two parts, such as inbox, inbox.msf, sent, sent.msf. After you do the search and save to a folder, you want to export the folder itself, not individual emails. They will be in the folder. you can ignore copying the msf entries.
